summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors discussing a victim's allegations of sexual assault by Leon Black, facilitated by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the victim's account of abuse, investigation efforts by the District Attorney's Office, and coordination between different prosecutorial offices.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Billionaire financier accused of violently sexually assaulting a victim trafficked by Epstein and Maxwell in 2001.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier who, with Ghislaine Maxwell, trafficked the victim and introduced her to Leon Black for a 'massage' that led to assault.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate who helped traffic and control the victim, introducing her to Epstein when she was 17.

persons.name: Jeanne Christensen
persons.context: Attorney representing the victim in connection with civil claims related to Epstein and others, including Leon Black.

persons.name: Adam Horowitz
persons.context: Attorney who represented the victim during initial interviews with the District Attorney's Office and reached out regarding a civil suit against Leon Black.

persons.name: John Luc Brunel
persons.context: Deceased modeling agent and Epstein associate whom the victim stated Epstein introduced her to for similar massages.

persons.name: Larry
persons.context: Pilot mentioned by the victim as flying her and others to St. Thomas on Epstein's behalf.

connections.description: Worked together to traffic, control, and abuse the victim, with Maxwell introducing her to Epstein.
Epstein introduced the victim to Black by name and facilitated a situation that led to Black's alleged sexual assault of the victim.
Both were involved with the same victim trafficked by Epstein and Maxwell, with Black allegedly assaulting her after an introduction by Epstein.
Both attorneys worked on the victim's case, with Horowitz initially representing her and Christensen later taking over representation.
Epstein introduced the victim to Brunel for 'similar massages,' indicating a pattern of introducing victims to associates.

events.title: Sexual Assault by Leon Black
events.description: A victim, trafficked by Epstein and Maxwell, was driven from Virginia to Epstein's New York townhouse where Epstein introduced her to Leon Black. Black allegedly violently assaulted her, tearing her clothes, biting her vagina, and forcing sex toys on her, causing bleeding that required medical attention.

events.title: DANY Interview with Victim
events.description: The District Attorney's Office of New York County interviewed the victim, who was represented by attorney Adam Horowitz, regarding allegations against Leon Black and her trafficking by Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Victim Discloses Allegations to Attorney
events.description: The victim told her attorney, Adam Horowitz, about the allegations against Leon Black. At that time, a related complaint had been filed but specific details about the massage and biting were redacted.

events.title: Prosecutor Call and Memo
events.description: Prosecutors held a call and created a memo detailing the victim's allegations, investigation status, and lack of independent corroboration for the claims against Black and another individual named Staley.

keyFacts: A victim alleges she was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein and, in 2001, was violently sexually assaulted by billionaire Leon Black at Epstein's New York townhouse.

The assault by Black was described as extremely violent, involving biting, forced penetration with sex toys, and causing bleeding that required medical attention. Black left money on a table afterward, which Epstein took.

The victim was introduced to Epstein by Maxwell when she was approximately 17 years old in 2001/2002 and was controlled by them, receiving luxury gifts after trips and being subjected to physical abuse.

Prosecutors from the Manhattan DA's Office and the Southern District of New York are coordinating an investigation into the allegations against Leon Black, but note a lack of independent corroboration has been found.
The victim's medical records from 2011-2023 mention sexual assaults and Epstein, with more specific corroboration appearing in records after news reports about the Epstein investigation.
